original_title: James Brown Live At The Boston Garden - April 1968
overview: Live at the Boston Garden: April 5, 1968 is a concert film starring James Brown. Recorded at the Boston Garden by WGBH-TV the night after the assassination of Martin Luther King, Jr., it was broadcast live in an effort to quell potential riots in the city. The recording circulated as a bootleg before it was officially released on DVD by Shout! Factory in 2008 as part of the box set I Got the Feelin': James Brown in the '60s.[1] It received a stand-alone release in 200

production_companies.name: Sony Music Entertainment Visual Works Inc.

title: James Brown Live At The Boston Garden - April 1968
